body:
Comment 8 by **jp@webmaster.ms**: 
I found that r2 is used to return EDX on linux/386 and darwin/386.
Only windows always have 0 in r2.

Perhaps it is worth to ask in mailing-list if the people interesting in possibility of
adding r3 to return ST(0) on 386 and xmm0 on amd64 in order to cover all the cases with
dlls calls and avoid returning to the topic when somebody will have such a dll.
